oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Old Man, the Little Hare, and the Lions. Related by =giri-sse (L VII.-1. 6032-6040, partly translated). A fragment of the above story was also related by =giri-sse (L VII.-1. 6031). Explanatory note in the Katkop dialect, by Dia!kwain (L VII.-1. 6031 rev. and 6032 rev.). An untranslated version of the song of the old man who calls for mist (/kumm) to come to the 'killing place' as he hops away from the Lions (after cutting off his bad leg). 1) p.6039v: the name of the mist in the song is |kumm (according to both Jan Ronebout and Dia!kwain), 2) See also Fragment of a story about the old man, the little Hare and the travelling Lions, 3) This story is found in Book VII-1.
